intro: Paullinia tetragona, commonly known as the four-angled guava, is a tropical plant native to South America. It is a member of the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive four-angled stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns red when mature. Paullinia tetragona is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional uses in folk medicine.
